alert.note: Alert for Jasper (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 17 at 2:30PM EDT until September 20 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Georgia, including the following counties, Bryan, Chatham, Liberty, Long and McIntosh. Portions of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Jasper. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 230 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pooler, Bluffton, Richmond Hill, Tybee Island, Coffee Bluff, Windsor Forest, Hunter Army Airfield, Midtown Savannah, I-16/I-95 Interchange, Downtown Savannah, Hutchinson Island, Savannah International Airport, Wilmington Island, Godley Station, Fort Pulaski National Monument, Bellinger Hill Area, Jones, McIntosh, Montgomery and Garden City.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Heavy rain in Downtown Savannah will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.
